Package GridWorld

Class Grid

java.lang.Object
GridWorld.Grid
public class Grid extends Object
Package to permit an arbitrary sized rectangular grid to be created and then filled with characters. Locations within the grid are identified by zero based indexing relative to the top left corner of the grid. That is, the top left corner of the grid is row 0 and column 0. The bottom right corner is identified by the height of the grid minus 1 and the width of the grid minus 1. Specifying locations outside the grid will generate exceptions.

This will place your two initials into the (approximately) middle of the grid. 


    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Grid paper =  Grid.create(5, 8, '.');
        markInitials(paper);
        paper.dump();         // useful for debugging
        printInitials(paper); // using own code to make output pretty
    }

    private static void markInitials(Grid paper) {
        int middleRow = (paper.getHeight() + 1) / 2 - 1;
        int middleColumn = (paper.getWidth() + 1) / 2 - 1;

        System.out.println("What are your two initials?");
        for (int i = 0; i <= 1; i++) {
            char initial = keyboard.next().charAt(0);
            paper.mark(middleRow, middleColumn + i, initial);
        }
    }

    private static void printInitials(Grid paper) {
        int row = 2;  // arbitrary, but useful here
        System.out.print("Initials found: ");
        for (int column = 0; column < paper.getWidth(); column++) {
            if (paper.get(row,column) != paper.getFill())
                System.out.print(paper.get(row,column));
        }
        System.out.println();
    }

produces 

What are your two initials?
banana garden
       0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7
Row 0: ., ., ., ., ., ., ., .
Row 1: ., ., ., ., ., ., ., .
Row 2: ., ., ., b, g, ., ., .
Row 3: ., ., ., ., ., ., ., .
Row 4: ., ., ., ., ., ., ., .
       0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7
Initials found: bg

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Grid create()
      Constructs a square grid of default size (10x10) filled using the default character (' ').
      Returns:
      a default sized Grid
      See Also:
      • DEFAULT_SIZE
      • DEFAULT_FILL

    • create

      public static Grid create(int rows, int columns)
      Constructs a rectangular grid which is rows tall and columns wide entirely filled with the default character (' '). If the parameters are negative or 0, then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows in the grid
      columns - the number of columns in the grid
      Returns:
      a Grid of appropriate dimension
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when either parameter is negative or zero.
      See Also:
      • DEFAULT_FILL

    • create

      public static Grid create(int rows, int columns, char fillChar)
      Constructs a rectangular grid which is rows tall and columns wide entirely filled with the fillchar character. If the row/column parameters are negative or 0, then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows in the grid
      columns - the number of columns in the grid
      fillChar - the character that is used to fill the entire grid
      Returns:
      a Grid of appropriate dimension
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when either parameter is negative or zero.

    • create

      public static Grid create(int[] dimension)
      Constructs a rectangular grid which is rows tall and columns wide and entirely filled with the default character (' '), when the dimensions are provided as an array and the first element is the number of rows and the second element is the number of columns. If either of the dimensions are negative or 0, then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      dimension - an array containing just the number of rows and columns in the grid
      Returns:
      a Grid of appropriate dimension
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when either dimension is negative or zero.
      See Also:
      • DEFAULT_FILL

    • create

      public static Grid create(int[] dimension, char fillChar)
      Constructs a grid which is rows tall and columns wide entirely filled with the fillChar character, when the dimensions are provided as an array and the first element is the number of rows and the second element is the number of columns. If either of the dimensions are negative or 0, then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      dimension - an array containing just the number of rows and columns in the grid
      fillChar - the character used to fill the entire grid.
      Returns:
      a Grid of appropriate dimension
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when either dimension is negative or zero.

    • getSize

      public int[] getSize()
      Returns the number of rows and number of columns in the grid.
      Returns:
      an array of two elements which represents the number of rows and columns in the grid (in that order within the array)

      public char getFill()
      Returns the character that was originally used to fill the grid.

      the fill character of the grid

    • mark

      public void mark(int row, int column, char symbol)
      Places the single symbol within the grid at the location indicated by row and column. If the location is outside of the grid then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      row - the row to put the symbol
      column - the column to put the symbol
      symbol - the symbol to record on the grid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row/column parameters are negative or taller/wider than the grid

    • mark

      public void mark(int[] location, char symbol)
      Places a single symbol within the grid at the location (row, column) given. If the location is outside of the grid then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      location - the location of where to put the symbol
      symbol - the symbol to record on the grid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location is negative or taller/wider than the grid

    • erase

      public void erase(int row, int column)
      Erases the single symbol within the grid at the location indicated by row and column by replacing it with the grid's original fill character. If the location is outside of the grid then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      row - the row to erase the symbol
      column - the column to erase the symbol
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row/column parameters are negative or taller/wider than the grid

    • erase

      public void erase(int[] location)
      Erases the single symbol within the grid at the location (row and col) given by replacing it with the grid's original fill character. If the location is outside of the grid then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      location - the location to erase the symbol
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location is negative or taller/wider than the grid

    • get

      public char get(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the single symbol within the grid at the location indicated by row and column. If the location is outside of the grid then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      row - the row to retrieve the symbol
      column - the column to retrieve the symbol
      Returns:
      the symbol at that location on the grid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the row/column parameters are negative or taller/wider than the grid

    • get

      public char get(int[] location)
      Retrieves the single symbol within the grid at the location (row and col) given. If the location is outside of the grid then an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      location - the location of the symbol on the grid
      Returns:
      the symbol at that location on the grid
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location is negative or taller/wider than the grid

    • dump

      public void dump()
      Outputs the grid in array format for debugging purposes.
